website_summaries.verdict: We love the option to convert this model from a pole saw to a chainsaw, and the powerful motor sets it apart from other models.
pros: The 8 amp motor is the most powerful of any model we considered, and can handle limbs of moderate thickness, making it a good option for users who need to handle larger limbs when landscaping or chopping logs
For users who need both a pole saw and a handheld chainsaw, this model conveniently converts to both
The 8.8-foot telescoping pole offers an additional reach long enough for low-hanging limbs or trees of moderate height
cons: At almost 8.5 lbs., this model is heavier than most, and may be difficult to maneuver for some users

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: As a middle - aged woman, I have stopped asking my handy men friends to recommend tools. I have discovered we look for different things... I love this saw. It is so straightforward and easy to use. It is easy to transition the saw on and off the pole- seriously, like 5 seconds. It is lightweight enough that I can control it well. Prior to buying, I read reviews criticizing plastic parts. They are plenty strong and durable, as long as you don't abuse it... which brings me back to my first sentence... I highly recommend this saw. I love everything about it, no criticism, and I have used it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Liz828

customer_reviews.title: Locking mechanism for the extended pole is not secure - made of plastic. Can be dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: The locking mechanism does not look sturdy and came off on me while using it. This is very dangerous and can seriously injure an operator. The locking tab is made of plastic. How can a maker of a chain saw use plastic parts to secure connecting parts? For this reason I can't give it a higher rating.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Wong

customer_reviews.title: Good chainsaw, un safe as a polesaw.
customer_reviews.text: No complaints when in chain saw mode, but as a pole saw the handle can disconnect from the extension if the latch button (which is only about an inch away) is merely brushed, leading to the saw falling as it's on the end of a 4-7 foot pool now supported by one hand. Its very unnerving and happens several times on each occasion I have used the saw.
customer_reviews.author: Knap

customer_reviews.title: Great saw and even better price!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing so much and highly recommend it! I convinced my dad to get himself one also instead of messing with a manual saw for tree trimming. I can’t believe they now are marked down even more than what I paid. Lucky him. I have saved so much money just doing my tree trimming myself. There is a YouTube video that made assembly easy. I have only had the chain fall off once and full disclosure it was my one fault. Don’t forget to buy the oil as you will need that. And remember to refill oil before each use. I also invested in a 100ft extension chord because I am a new homeowner and didn’t have one.
customer_reviews.author: DavisChicken

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: It worked very well. We used it for two solid days trimming trees. Some limbs were 8" thick. Still sharp too.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dugan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great, only problem it is top heavier than I liked
customer_reviews.author: Jeff N.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design, almost got hurt using product.
customer_reviews.text: Cuts good while it works, only spent about 30 minutes cutting then the plastic that holds the saw on the end decided to snap and come falling down. Dangerous product, WHY WOULD YOU PUT PLASTIC TO SUPPORT A HEAVY SAW, avoid this at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: TO start ... Read the instructions. It will make things go very easy. We bought this to trim some large trees in our backyard , my wife wanted to do the work herself .She is inexperienced with chainsaws after a few mins of small cuts and some test cuts she was ready to go. the saw is well built , works great and is easy to use . It works great and cuts well . branches up to 8 inches are a breeze. buy one .
customer_reviews.author: edward johnson

customer_reviews.title: Leaking bar oil all over garage
customer_reviews.text: Assembled, used, and stored according to instructions. Two days later, I found that the chainsaw had leaked all over my cabinetry. Sunjoe rep. stated that ‘ALL their models do that’, although it never gives that warning in the manual and does not advise storing horizontally. Rep also stated they would not be able to do anything, although there is a supposed two year warranty. Save your money and time to prevent a mess and go with something that either gives better direction, or doesn’t leak all over your garage.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Its a work-horse machine!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had my doubts but I was so impressed with the other Sun Joe products that I took a chance. I am extremely happy I did. Works like a champ. Especially useful to be able to detach the saw from the extension pole to cut up the branches into smaller and more manageable pieces. Very powerful. No pressure needed to cut through 8" diameter branches. I cut down 12 big branches, and trimmed two smaller trees, cut up and stacked them by myself in less than 2 hours. READ THE DIRECTIONS!! SAFTEY FIRST. THIS IS NOT A TOY.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Beaulieu

customer_reviews.title: The chain tension screw failed  and poor support
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good saw and worked well for one day. The adjustment screw is made from soft metal and bent, so I could not tighten the chain. This makes the saw unusable. SunJoe has promised me 3 replacment screws for weeks, but they have never sent them. I would return this saw if I could, but the time for that has run out while trying to work with SunJoe. Very disappointing. Don't buy this saw.
customer_reviews.author: KDV

customer_reviews.title: Better than Remington
customer_reviews.text: I was borrowing my neighbor's Remington Pole saw so much I thought I'd better get my own. The Sun Joe was lighter and much easier to change from hand saw to pole saw. Literally in seconds! I actually chopped down 2 cottonwood trees. One had a 20" trunk, so I had to saw around it 360 deg with this 10" saw. Then of course I had to chop both into little pieces to haul away. Saws very fast and the 10" chain is replaceable. The oil dispenser also works much better than the remington manual oiling system.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a nice saw - NO CHAIN OIL WITH IT???
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a decent product. It went together in a few minutes and the instructions were good. It is light and manageable. I don't love that most of it is plastic, but I am not chopping trees down, so it is probably OK. My only issue - HOW DO YOU NOT SEND A SMALL BOTTLE OF CHAIN OIL WITH THIS PRODUCT??? Can't use it without it. Unless I missed something, it does not come with it. Order bar and chain oil if you buy this.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Mangold

customer_reviews.title: Get's small jobs done
customer_reviews.text: Assembly wasn't too complicated but there are definitely some mechanics that needs to be reworked to allow the saw to function better. It was used to cut a few tree's with branches maybe the size of a quarter at best and the chain kept popping off. It was configured the way it was supposed to, but after cutting one or two it would pop and need to be reset. It was annoying. We ended up getting the job done but if your looking to cut thicker branches or just want to avoid being tempted at throwing the thing at the wall. I would pass over this one. I definitely wouldn't trust it while using the extended handle!
customer_reviews.author: B Kibble

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t come with chain oil.
customer_reviews.text: Did not come with at least a starter amount of chain oil, which is necessary for operation. I may be stupid as a newbie to chain saws for not ordering oil at the same time but this manufacture is stupid for selling an item that doesn’t come with everything needed to at least get started. Now I’ll be a week behind schedule. From one dummy to another dummy, thanks.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Works well but can be challenging to control when the pole is extended.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to trim some low lying branches. The design of this pole chain saw is pretty clever. The saw portion assembles and disassembles from the pole easily, and the pole also extends and retracts safely and easily. But be aware that when the pole is extended, leverage is working against you. Even though the saw is not particularly heavy, when it is extended away from you, it can be much harder to lift and control. Be sure you have adequate strength and balance, and that you are working from solid ground. When the saw is removed from the pole, it works very well to cut up small branches.
customer_reviews.author: wamaruna

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews and I was a skeptic. But I made the purchase. I was not looking to take down trees. Just clean up a few palm trees. It worked GREAT. Very happy with it. I used it and so did my step father. We were both very pleased. It can get a bit top heavy. But it works great. Nothing broke and nothing came loose. I used it for what it was intended.
customer_reviews.author: Ladida

customer_reviews.title: the only thing i dislike so far was the box it was shipped in
customer_reviews.text: the only thing i dislike so far was the box it was shipped in. when i got it from UPS it was in bad shape. the UPS driver rang my door bell and before i could open the door he was back to his truck and moving. the box was broke in half and was held together only by the bottom. I took picture of it. Everything seems to be there. the saw works great. no problem with it
customer_reviews.author: Frank Livingston

customer_reviews.title: Great for small homeowners that don't want to deal with gas
customer_reviews.text: I hate gasoline and prefer to use electric tools. I'm able to easily handle this chainsaw. Make sure you buy oil before embarking on your landscaping journey, however, because the chain and saw require it and it's not included. We have used it several times over the last month to lop off 20 year old juniper shrub/trees, several small beech and flowering trees and other landscaping that needed cutting back. It looks pretty dainty in my husband's hands but I am able to easily handle it despite being smaller (5'1"). It does get heavy if you fully extend the pole portion but is easily handled by 2 people.
customer_reviews.author: Smelly SmingsleyTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS SAW!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts, but having limited strength, this saw was perfect!!! A tree struck by lightning and limited funds I bought this. It took care of the tree like a hot knife through butter. Not to heavy, with the pole it gets a little heavy for me but I too care of the tree in two hours. I’m very impressed!!! Would highly recommend this saw!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Debra Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: False advertising on pole length
customer_reviews.text: Take note, the pole does NOT extend 8.3 inches like the description mentions, it may, at best extend 6 feet. If you’re buying this to cut branches that are higher than 10 feet, don’t rely on this product being your solution. The description says that this is 15’ overhead length, that’s if you’re 6’ tall and can hold the pole saw safely above your head, which is extremely difficult. I was hit when a large branch I was cutting fell on me, this is false advertising!!
customer_reviews.author: Denise Kaczmarek

customer_reviews.title: Very good an flexible
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied, and I believe it is an very good value for the money. I have a larger one with a 16' blade and was a bit skeptical about this one. I was greatly surprise when I was able to cut trunks & branches as easy as a hot knife on butter. Adding the pole is very easy and simple. The only point I would like to see is the possibility to adjust the angle of the cutting head when it is connected to the extension pole (I saw that feature in other models, and I thought it was not really important, but I had a couple of occasions when it would have been nice to have it).
customer_reviews.author: rodrigo

customer_reviews.title: he was very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: My husband ordered this tool to help him trim large branches without climbing on a ladder, he was very happy with it, he was also happy with Amazon and the method that it was sent.
customer_reviews.author: patricia costa-lake

customer_reviews.title: A solid product for a very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I never used a chain saw before, but refuse to pay the yard guy $500 for trimming some branches, so I bought this tool to do it my self. The assembly took me a bit longer to complete, but I think it's really my fault. The chain saw works very well (I like the fact that it's electric, so no need to worry about getting gas), and very easy to adjust the pole length. I also like that fact that ot does not need battery (which adds weight). Overall, it's a really solid product!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Chang

customer_reviews.title: Sun Joe extension chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I really liked it at first I'm glad I got the warranty because it shooting Sparks out now I've got the contact Snow Joe to get it fixed and I hope I don't have to pay what is called a bench warranty when you have to send it to them hoping I'll cover the cost and fix it or send me a new one or just give me my money back ...disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne

customer_reviews.title: Convenient for tall trimming, easy-start, a bit unwieldy due to heavy-weighted end
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back in March but only just used it in July to cut some stray branches from the trees lining my driveway. I also used ot ti prune "low'handing" drooping branches on my large silver maple tree in the backyard. I did find I had to stand on a small stool, and the tool was a bit unwieldy due to its heavy end, but once I got used to it I basically just leaned it onto the branch and let it do the work.
customer_reviews.author: Raj Against The Machine

customer_reviews.title: This a great tool for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Living in northern Michigan we have a lot of trees, after each winter many need trimming. This is a great product that is well built and does what it was intended to do. It expands easily and cuts through everything I have attempted to cut. It is not meant to be a heavy duty chain saw. For that I get out the big saw. If you have a lot of trimming to do and want to stay off the ladder try this.
customer_reviews.author: Norman A

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the tool shed
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about it at first but decided to try it. works well for what it is designed to do. If you have light trimming to do, then it is a great tool. If you are trying to do robust work, then it's not the tool for you.
customer_reviews.author: Papachunks

customer_reviews.title: For the price it is a good saw
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Sun Joe SWJ807E a few times now without any issues. The product I fairly simple to set up. The saw has cut through everything I have tried without out any problems ( branch size 1-5 inches). I did have the the pole disconnect from the trigger, it was my fault for bumping the button but it could have been designed better so that wouldn’t happen. When the saw is fully extended it is fairly heavy and not overly easy to maneuver. Overall for the price I would definitely but this saw again.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Well made and powerful.
customer_reviews.text: While this chainsaw reflects the durable design and construction that is typical of SunJoe products (I own 5 of them), it has 2 issues that preclude a 5 star rating: 1) The saw itself, without the pole, is heavy and long vs. the typical 10" chainsaw so single hand operation for quick pruning of small limbs is cumbersome. When used with the pole, it's somewhat more top heavy than other 10" pole saws. 2) The motor cooling fans built into the saw are quite powerful and blow back on the operator, so you have this constant, irritating wind in your face.
customer_reviews.author: Big Foot - OR

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I trimmed a lot of tree branches and then cut them up. This saw was pretty easy to put together and use. I had no issues whatsoever. If you use the pole, you do have to have some arm strength or break up a large job. I did use it on a ladder (not recommended), but made sure the ladder was stable and positioned safely. It was definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: kim c.

customer_reviews.title: Great unit and great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Overall great product. Cuts really well. Adding pole extensions takes just seconds. Support is great with Sun Joe. I had a small issue with the extension. I submitted through Sun Joe and had a response with 24 hours. We conversed and they ended up sending me a new unit and asked for me to return the old one. I think they could have just sent me a new pole, but they wanted to make sure everything was resolved.
customer_reviews.author: BSewell

customer_reviews.title: Happy with product
customer_reviews.text: I was quoted $1000+ to trim the huge tree in front of my house. Got this saw so I could just do it myself. Really happy with the result. Was really easy to construct & use considering I'm a beginner & had no idea what I was doing.
customer_reviews.author: Vrtualme

customer_reviews.title: Works well on it's own too, decoupled from pole
customer_reviews.text: This pole saw worked great trimming some fruit trees around the house. After trimming branches up to 5" the saw worked well on it's own to cut them into firewood sized pieces. It's easy to attach and remove the pole. The oil reservoir level was easy to monitor and didn't need constant refilling. I adjusted the new chain a couple of times per instructions and had no problems. Trimming with the pole it helps to get the gripper against the limb for a clean cut. I did cut some firewood about 6" thick and it was ok but had to take it slow without too much pressure.
customer_reviews.author: D. Driskell

customer_reviews.title: Good depending on how much you use it.
customer_reviews.text: This pole saw was easy to put together. I was fortunate to have some chain saw oil on hand as none was included. While sawing branches, the chain came off several times. This meant going into the garage and replacing the chain only to have the chain come off on the next branch. The company could devise a way to attach the chainsaw tool to the cord.
customer_reviews.author: Edward "Ike" Porter

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Would have been nice if it came with the necessary oil, but isn't too big of an issue. Does seem like it consumes oil faster than I would expect. I was able to use it for 1 tree in my yard , but I misjudged how tall the other palm tree was, and this was not long enough to reach
customer_reviews.author: Aeon Psych

customer_reviews.title: Good saw for money
customer_reviews.text: Cuts much larger diameter trees if you know what you're doing. Had to replace the tension screw because it fell off. Can order a small part replacement pack on Walmart for $19. Cut down 1/4 acre of small trees with this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A real workhorse
customer_reviews.text: I used this extensively with and without the pole extension with great results. I cleared a large lot, taking down a huge amount of branches and small trees up to 6-8 inches with no trouble at all. Probably about 12-15 hours of time over a few days. It used very little oil and has not leaked in any position or in storage. All I've had to do is tighten the chain occasionally which is normal. This is one of the best yard tools I've ever owned. Note that I did NOT use the pole in its extended position as it becomes quite heavy and harder to control. Its easy to use otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Wilson

customer_reviews.title: May just get another one for me
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a present for my 80+ year old father. As I suspected it is a tad bit too heavy for him (as expected) but not for his daughter! It was easy to put together, easy to use and he loves it. The handle comes apart easily for different lengths, the chain saw makes quick work of most branches (I assume it has limits but haven’t reached them yet. Will probably but another one for me
customer_reviews.author: K. Sienkiewicz

customer_reviews.title: GREAT VERSATILE SAW, GREAT PRICE
customer_reviews.text: This saw is very easy to assemble and use, was perfect for the work I need to do around my house. The versatility of the extending pole is what I have got the most use out of. Having to drag around an extension cable can sometimes be a bit of a pain but power saws are three times more expensive so it is worth the aggravation. Great saw for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B Long

customer_reviews.title: Good little saw
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I have about 3 hours total use now, some large cedar limbs as well as other types of trees and bushes. After reading some reviews, I was wondering, but it cuts great , haven't had the chain loosen other than the initial break in, or anything come apart and it doesn't even leak oil. I expected it to, as my previous saw did when put away. (Other brand)
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to clean some brush out from behind the house and trim some tree limbs. It was easy to assemble, and it works great. I was impressed with how easy it cut through the brush and the tree limbs. It's got plenty of power. For lightweight work around the house, this is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Scott France

customer_reviews.title: Oil & tension : keep an eye on them.
customer_reviews.text: We love this tool! It’s super easy to switch from pole to chainsaw-only. First time we used it for a couple of hours with no problems at all. I advise checking the tension and oil level every so often. Oil is a consumable and with all that vibration it’s entirely normal for the tension loosen.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner saw and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: First time ever using a power saw like this, and it was fun and easy to use! It cuts well, taking down limbs the size it suggests and the extension pole is great. Assembling it is pretty easy but the sprocket to adjust tension is a little tricky if you’ve never done it before. Glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Nolan - Prime Autotainment

customer_reviews.title: Great for trimming branches and cutting down small trees.
customer_reviews.text: This tool worked like a charm to cut down a few smaller trees (10" in diameter) and trim a bunch of large branches. It was very easy to use and worked all day for clearing an area of smaller tress and downed branches. I like using the pole extension to trim over hanging branches, but I thought it was a bit unwieldy arms fully extended above . Of course they tell you not to use it that way. I thought it might be too much to handle (on the extended pole) for a smaller woman. Overall, it was perfect for what I needed done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small but strong
customer_reviews.text: It took me a bit to figure it out so the belt didn't fall off but after that I was able to cut down a medium size tree with about 8inch trunk and then cut that to smaller peaces. The tree was leaning on a fence do to a storm and this chain saw did the trick for me couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Anna Garibay

customer_reviews.title: did not do the job
customer_reviews.text: Bought the saw for few 6 inch branches I needed to trim. After multiple attempts, chain kept getting loose then eventually the screw that holds the blade to the saw got twisted. Had to be new blade, chain and screw/nut. Still could not get any of the fig tree or mulberry tree 5-6 inch branches. Will go to donation tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Saw
customer_reviews.text: This is one powerful saw, not a toy, the chain is sharp and ready to go once it is assembled, cut limbs like butter, before you realize it you will have a huge pile of limbs and branches to haul off. The versatility to adapt to a handheld chain saw is a plus. I would recommend this product...
customer_reviews.author: Clydej

customer_reviews.title: Great Sun Joe Product!  Versatile and Easy to Use!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product which will save you time and money! Did one run at my trees and I've already saved money from having to hire outside help. Definitely enough to pay for itself, and then some. Don't go chopping off branches until you do some reading on the subject first. Know what you're doing and why you're doing it first. It doesn't continuously leak oil like my last pole saw, which is great! It's both helpful and easy to switch from pole to standard use. Definitely worth the added dollars for this option. Very happy with price and quality of this Sun Joe unit.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Upp S Ticky

customer_reviews.title: Easy conversion to hand saw and back
customer_reviews.text: Was a birthday gift for my husband. Used it yesterday, he was able to cut down some limbs quickly. Once they were down, it was very easy for him to reconfigure it to a hand saw to cut the limb into smaller pieces. He was very impressed with the ease of detaching it from the pole to use as a hand saw. Even today he has gone on and on about it
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time yesterday. Worked Great. I should have bought one of these years ago. I love how the saw detaches from the pole. Great for cutting up the small stuff. Saw blade was sharp and cut thru everything quickly. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to have a tool to trim all the branches around the home and this product is perfect for it. It can be used with/without extension poles. Cuts up to 8 inch diameter trunks/branches. I used it to cut the branches of a spruce tree that was extending and rubbing against my house.
customer_reviews.author: Shibu kunneth

customer_reviews.title: Problem with disengagement when using the pole
customer_reviews.text: I knew this from reviews, but went ahead and purchased. I was actually surprised though at how quickly and frequently the disengagement happens. Makes it annoying to use with the pole attachment. Also surprised the company has not addressed. Heavier than I had anticipated when assembled with the pole.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie C. Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: Comes apart without warning
customer_reviews.text: nice power. good reach. comes apart without warning. had to duct tape it. will have to remove the tape to convert it from pole saw to regular chain saw. Dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: jaym

customer_reviews.title: love it, it took down 13 trees standing 14 ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased Sun Joe and boy did, Wee!!! love it, it took down 13 trees standing 14 feet tall, the trees were in a cluster. It was my husband father day gift. Oh if lose the cap to the oil on the saw like," We did, just get a top off the 5 hour energy bottle it fits perfect. and you can use the energy, Big thank you to the company for this product.
customer_reviews.author: ALICE REECE

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great - Loved the Extension Arm
customer_reviews.text: This pole chainsaw exceeded my expectations. My neighbor's 40 foot pine tree was hanging all over our driveway and was touching the roof of our house. With the Sun Joe 10" saw, I was able to take down all the branches I wanted to clear - even up to the level of the roof. I'm also glad I got the model that provides detachment of the saw from the pole - that made it very easy to chop up the large branches into smaller pieces once they were removed from the tree trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Brenton

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase this electric pole saw, but rather than rent a gas one for $45 per 1/2 day, I figured since I only need it a few times a year I took the gamble. Glad I did. This unit was surprisingly strong and worked like a champ. I assumed I would have to pull out my big gas chainsaw for the larger branches to cut them up, but never did. This converts easily, has plenty of power and cuts well. Highly recommend this for anything light use.
customer_reviews.author: Abeam

customer_reviews.title: Must-have for the suburban homeowner
customer_reviews.text: Pesky saplings, small trees, and low hanging, unorderly branches are not a match for this with it's pole extension and ten inch bar. Construction is rigid, and assembly takes minutes and is straightforward. Price is also quite reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Great Telescope Chain Saw
customer_reviews.text: High quality and heavy duty, easy to use, and very easy to assembles except the adjustment of the chain and that with every chain with all brands, most customers complaints from the chain adjustment. Read instruction carefully and seek others help if needed. I let someone adjusted for me in 2 minutes. Every thing is great
customer_reviews.author: SHARIF MASOUDI

customer_reviews.title: Built for man,  Pretty, hard working for a woman
customer_reviews.text: I haven't use this yet but I'm looking forward to. Love the color in all its purple. The pole is what sold me I have some trimming high of branches and even I'm not old I'm also not a spring chicken lol. I can fo what i need without a ladder. Doesn't seem to heavy to use. So yes when I use I'm come back and report how happy I am 😉
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical when I purchased the Sun Joe Tree Saw. However, I'm glad I made it! The instructions that are included made this thing easy especially if you are new to chainsaws!! I would highly recommend getting this I cut down shrubs, tree limbs, and stumps with little ease. The weight to this chainsaw is light but heavy enough to help cut down tree branches and durable enough to cut a full grown mesquite tree. I am looking forward to purchasing another piece of equipment from Sun Joe.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Lord

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw and Easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and love how it handles.. It has great reach and cuts through branches easily. I had no problems starting and love how it can be used with the pole or without. I would recommend this saw. Assembly was simple and chain went on with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Darla

customer_reviews.title: Useless product
customer_reviews.text: This is a useless product. You can’t even cut a 2inch diameter branch. At the most you can cut 1 inch branch, which can be cut with a hand saw. So better buy a chain saw
customer_reviews.author: R. SYED

customer_reviews.title: I love the electric because its so simple
customer_reviews.text: little skeptical at first, but I actually have found this to work perfectly for what I need. I love the electric because its so simple, load the blade the oil and you are good to go.Swapping between the chainsaw and polesaw was super useful and much quicker and easier than I anticipated. I am not paid for this I just bought it cut down 10-12 limbs and loved using it.
customer_reviews.author: Roronoa Zoro

customer_reviews.title: One fantastic tool!
customer_reviews.text: Lots of power. With my 12 foot step ladder I trimmed branches 18 feet from the ground!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel W. Raasch

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!  Cuts trees with a size of my wrist in seconds!  Always make sure it’s oiled!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice saw! Very easy to use. Warning can be addictive, Once you started cutting trees and bushes around the house you will want to continue and start looking for something else to cut! :-). Needs to be oiled regularly do not forget that!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael I.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pole saw
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is lighter than most of the other pole saws. Its very easy to assemble and use, I really like the snap and lock system. And it really cuts well. Like all chain saws, it leaks bar oil when not in use, not a big deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Electric Chain Saw
customer_reviews.text: Sun Joe SWJ807E 10 inch 8.0 Amp Electric Convertible Pole Chain Saw - It's small and lightwight but it packs a punch. I've taken down several trees in my yard with it, and it has held up extreamly well. I've cut through 5-6" diameter trees like their nothing. The extention rod has worked great, and it comes off and becomes a stand alone chain saw with ease.
customer_reviews.author: buystuffonamazon

customer_reviews.title: Simple and useful for occasional trimming
customer_reviews.text: This product is useful for a small home with trees relatively close to your power outlets. Obviously you cannot take it out on an open farm. But in my experience it has been sturdy and easy to use. I’d recommend it for the homeowner with a single family home who needs to do some basic branch or shrub management every 1-2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Eat tha treees
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to buy ball and chain oil. Had a friend recommend this to me. He didn’t buy the oil. Now have a 7 finger friend. This things does WORK. Moved to a near area and made friends instantly when they saw the power saw I had. Worth it
customer_reviews.author: Bmurphy1

customer_reviews.title: Put the chain on the right way!
customer_reviews.text: As long as you put the chain on properly...it's pretty easy with the directions provided...this thing does a great job. I've used it for a couple months now and it's the perfect option for those with light residential tree needs.
customer_reviews.author: kms

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: After I bought the Sun Joe de-thatcher and scarifier and found it to be a good machine, I decided to go ahead with this purchase, which I find this to be a useful addition to my tool arsenal. It does a great job of working both as a pole saw and as a chain saw. As a pole saw, it is slightly heavy but that's the nature of the beast. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AncientEvening

customer_reviews.title: Does the job I needed it for
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Ge sure to load it with chain and bar oil (sold separately). I spent the weekend cutting down a bunch of branches that were over my barn shed . Then I climbed on the roof to trim low hanging branches. I bought this for the convenience of going back and forth between pole and hand chainsaw, and the process is a snap. The handles slide off and the conversion can be done in the field without any fuss.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy
customer_reviews.text: This electric chain saw has been very easy to use. I have only had it a few months and used it several times without any issues. It does use the oil pretty fast so check the level often. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: foyboy

customer_reviews.title: Machine seems to work. But chain is starting to warp.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time this weekend. For some reason the chain interlocking grooves are starting to warp and get fatter than the groove openings causing the chain to come off of the 10" chain holder. When asked if they could send me a new chain they said it was not covered under warranty and need to spend $15 to get a replacement. Outstanding service lol
customer_reviews.author: Monique K.

customer_reviews.title: works as it should
customer_reviews.text: great little machine, eats right through 6" trunks high up in the air, I would venture to say you could probably cut much thicker trees if yo get creative cutting from multiple sides, highly recommend for home use
customer_reviews.author: jorgeGarcia

customer_reviews.title: Get what ya pay for
customer_reviews.text: It cuts good but the handle won't stay connected to the power. Got what i needed done cheaper then i could have paid someone to do it but if i had much more to do it probably wouldn't have lasted.
customer_reviews.author: dugg

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: Surprised. Purchased this saw to take care of a small project. I was tired of using a manual pole saw on a steep hillside. This worked great. The short bar is probably an advantage in that it doesn't have a lot of weight and the chain doesn't loosen as quickly as something on a longer bar.
customer_reviews.author: Venturen LLC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can’t beat it. Would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.author: Zulu echo Bob

customer_reviews.title: Weight could be an issue?
customer_reviews.text: It cuts well. Separating the handle of the saw to ready for trimming is awkward. The chainsaw handle partially blocks your view for precise trimming. Depending on your age and strength, the weight of the trimming unit could make extensive trimming an issue.
customer_reviews.author: boris karloff

customer_reviews.title: Nice dual use chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I used this to trim branches from a tree with some problems. The only thing I would ding this for is that it is a bit heavy when using it telescoped out to reach branches. It was a bit short for some of the branches I wanted to reach which I did not expect considering the tree is not especially tall.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: my husband really really likes this little chain saw. He has been able to accomplish many jobs that he couldn't have done with a larger, heavier chain saw. He's really glad we got it.
customer_reviews.author: grammma

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! I love this convertable
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad that I bought this over the BD. I was battling between this and BD 20V/40V/pole saw. The only "downside" of this Sun Joe is that it's wired. After using it, the wire is a an issue at all! and I don't have to worry about if I had enough power left in the battery. Plus this is a convertible. Not like BD you will need to buy 2 separate tools.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Great!! Does and excellent job. I was a tad worried when I purchased it because it comes in four colors. I thought it might not be a serious tool. It works great. Easy to work with. Husband likes it Ok.
customer_reviews.author: ALively

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: The manufacturer thought this chain saw out: instructions clear, assembly easy and ,as noted, a workhorse. Would suggest a plastic knife or similar item to clean out groove in the blade when cleaning-up saw to put away. Great job, Sun Joe
customer_reviews.author: Jpetri

customer_reviews.title: Cut easily through 5 inch live oak branches
customer_reviews.text: A bit heavy. Cut easily through 5 inch live oak branches.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Can reach branches normally too high. Save money on having to hire tree service
customer_reviews.author: Jakezoe

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Saw
customer_reviews.text: This saw is great! It works great! The adaptability is great! It is a slight bit heavy when on extended pole. But that’s to be expected. I would definitely buy this pole saw again.
customer_reviews.author: keith banks

customer_reviews.title: In the short version (without the pole) its very good saw for branches and small trees
customer_reviews.text: The only problem is with this saw is that when fully extended the saw gets disconnected from the extension pole. In the short version (without the pole) its very good saw for branches and small trees.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: 2 thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What a wonderful tool! I am very happy more happy than I expected to be with my purchase. This is a serious tool for trimming branches. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Harvester

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool, removeable extension is a plus
customer_reviews.text: Very handy, a little heavy because of the size of the saw when pole is fully extended. I have no complaints other than keep your fingers away from the release buttons when using the pole.
customer_reviews.author: valkyrie

customer_reviews.title: This little thing kicks a$$!
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of power for small branches, big limbs, or even 8" trunks. Feels solid, easy to handle. Well documented, easily assembled. When fully extended on its pole, it's a bit topheavy for easy maneuverability, but use your judgement.
customer_reviews.author: Magister Ludi

customer_reviews.title: The best thing I ever got from amazon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little giant a year ago I had a huge tree to cut down and I wanted to cut all the branches first using this saw. turn out that this little guy made most of the work, I also bought a 22" gas powered chain saw that died after a day's work. This little beast has been the best thing I've gotten from amazon
customer_reviews.author: Roman Naula

customer_reviews.title: It works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Great product, but at the maximum extension length the saw is very heavy (on that end) which makes it somewhat difficult to use to get to the higher branches. All in all, I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: Use oil, clean spray bit of wd40 before use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to assemble, I able to cut 6-8 inch small trees with/without extension handle. Powerful than I thought. Used 3 months, about 6 times no issues at all
customer_reviews.author: Beautyc

customer_reviews.title: Check that you get all the parts.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for about a hour. Then when it came time to tighten the chain we discovered we were missing the wrench. Sunjoe would not send me a wrench because I didn’t have the serial number. Called Amazon no luck on the wrench. So I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Trudy B.

customer_reviews.title: Electric chain saw that really does the job. solid piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely made, adjustments are easily made for chain. Extension pole works perfectly. Motor is surprisingly strong for an electric motor. Keep the chain sharp and it will do whatever you ask. nice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A very handy and versatile tool since the pole can be removed.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality fast cutting flexible since you can remove the pole. It is great tool for a home owner. I have used it several times on branches up to 3 inches thick.
customer_reviews.author: BFL

customer_reviews.title: Motor Failed
customer_reviews.text: Had it for less then two years. Only used it a handful of times and the motor burned up. Super disappointing. Sad junk in the world.
customer_reviews.author: Lara-Jean

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful
customer_reviews.text: Nice little set up. I needed something powerful enough to trim limbs from some trees and take down a rather big, thick trunked holly bush. This did not disappoint. Easy to use and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: peacegirl

product_meta.title: Sun Joe SWJ807E 10 inch 8.0 Amp Electric Convertible Pole Chain Saw, Green
product_meta.description: Color:GreenSAW WHAT YOU SEE - WITH THE ONE SAW THAT DOES DOUBLE DUTY! Tackle those hard-to-reach branches with ease. The Sun Joe SWJ807E 2-in-1 convertible electric pole chain + saw takes the danger and difficulty out of trimming your overgrown trees. Stand safely on solid ground and simply adjust the telescoping pole to gain up to 15 feet of overhead reach. Later, when the limbs are down and there's wood to be cut, the SWJ807E quickly converts to a hand-held chainsaw to make light work of loads of logs. Powered by a robust 8-amp motor, the SWJ807E can handle the most stubborn tree limbs up to 7-inches thick. It features a durable, 10-inch Sun Joe bar and chain with an auto-oiler to keep the bar and chain fully lubricated during use. Unlike gas-powered tools, SWJ807E is powered electrically, so you'll power up reliably every time with the push of a button, without having to deal with smoke, fumes, spark plugs or costly tune-ups. Plus the SWJ807E comes equipped with a built-in safety switch to prevent accidental starting. The Sun Joe SWJ807E convertible electric pole chain + saw carries a full two-year warranty.
feature_bullets: 2 tools in 1: pole chainsaw or chainsaw ; Powered by a robust 8-amp motor, the SWJ807E can handle the most stubborn tree limbs up to 9.5-inches thick
Ideal for cutting overhanging limbs and thin logs
Powerful 8-amp motor cuts branches up to 9.5 inches thick
10-inch Sun Joe cutting bar and chain with automatic lubrication.Cutting Diameter:7 inch

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars913 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
